website_summaries.verdict: 2 pounds of whole-bean, CCOF certified organic, medium-dark roast with rich, deep flavor and low acidity.
pros: Certified organic by California Certified Organic Farmers (CCOF)
Medium-dark roast, rich, smooth, and a hint of cocoa
Manufacturer acquires beans from Honduras, via Sharing Certified Program
cons: Another very popular organic coffee, but small percentage don't like the flavor

customer_reviews.title: Used to be excellent coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this coffee for almost 2 years and up until now it was very good, in my opinion something has drastically changed for the worse. Beans are now pale, don't seem fresh and taste a bit sour. Hoping they return to the supplier or process they were previously using but as of now i would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth c.

customer_reviews.title: My wife with lifelong stomach acid problems loves it and can drink multiple cups, finally!
customer_reviews.text: Really good coffee that is kind, from an acid standpoint. My wife has lifelong stomach issues and coffee tends to really give her serious indigestion if she has more than a cup. Yeah, not good to be a coffee addict and have serious stomach problems! Tried Puroast and almost too flat of a taste. This has been great for her. Good flavor and the ability to drink multiple cups without the issues that other brands have. Only issue I could mention is the bag we ordered and got was 'best buy March 2017' at the end of March 2017. But, we have half a bag left and it's still fine. I'm sure a fresher bag would taste even better.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: So Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I first tried this coffee back in 2015 - received it as a gift - and I absolutely loved it. Unfortunately, when my interstitial cystitis flares up, coffee can be an irritant. To keep that from happening, I was recently researching low-acid coffees to purchase and this coffee was on the list! Wow, I had no idea! So, I ordered some and enjoy it just as much as I did before. It really is one of the best, if not THE best, whole bean coffees I've ever had. Smooth, not bitter at all, wonderful aroma and the taste - so good!! (And it's less expensive than Simpatico, which was the other brand I was debating about buying.) Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Swamp Girl

customer_reviews.title: Once Amazing, Now Ashes
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened, but my husband and I are heartbroken. We've LOVED this coffee for years and felt we were spoiled for any other because it's been SOOOOOO good. Our last two bags, however, have been terrible. It's bitter and, like someone else said in another review, after brewing it almost smells like an ashtray! I hate to say this about a coffee we've loved for so long, but I would definitely not recommend purchasing this. Please, Subtle Earth, whatever you did, fix it and let me know because until you do, we're moving on in our relationship with you.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Diner coffee
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this coffee, especially since I bought 2 lbs and it has such high reviews. But I don't. It's boring, flat and tastes like really good diner coffee. I don't hate it, it's just not that interesting. I am finding out that I'm a huge coffee snob. You can get a fantastically flavorful medium roast. It IS possible. Check out GoCoffeeGo.com. There are no good coffees on Amazon. They are old, sitting whereever they sit until shipped, and I have spent so much money trying all the good ones. NOPE
customer_reviews.author: shoop

customer_reviews.title: Some dang good coffee
customer_reviews.text: Ok, first off, I’m a straight up coffee snob. I only do espresso, French press, or pour over. I use a coffee-specific temp control kettle, a manual burr grinder, with fresh beans ONLY that are always stored in a CO2 eliminating container. Obviously, I’ve tried literally hundreds of brands, and this is by far one of my top 5 go-to coffee beans. Prepared properly, the flavor is robust with literally zero bitter aftertaste that is common among cheaper beans. Definite notes of chocolate, which I very much like, especially when making a homemade latte. Seriously, it’s some dang good coffee. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D.M. Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT RECOMMEND Very bitter coffee
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT RECOMMEND Very bitter coffee. No one in our household likes it (three coffee drinkers). We even had a couple of our out-of-town guests try it and they didn't like it either. We didn't want to waste it so we tried mixing it 50/50 with another organic blend we had, but it still had such a bitter taste that we threw the brewed coffee out. The only thing we use it for is coffee cleanse.
customer_reviews.author: MoJo

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try
customer_reviews.text: If there was a 3.5 I’d select that. As many others have reported it is low acidity. It’s good but does leave a long lasting pleasurable taste after drinking. That’s a personal of a good coffee, however, we are drinking everyday and enjoy it. The bottom line for me about coffee is do I like the taste of the coffee or not. I like Honduran but prefer Guatemalan so I’m trying that next. Overall, definitely worth a try. Service wise, the coffee came in two days. I like that the company owner interacts with customers and looks very committed to his company, good products and excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Saif

customer_reviews.title: Passed the test with hardcore coffee drinkers
customer_reviews.text: I drink c. 2 cups of coffee a day; family and friends drink more. I've served the medium-dark roast to a number of them and it passed the test - flavorful and smooth, according to their responses. I love that the coffee is organic and grown in an environmentally sound way. Everyone wins with this one. I could pay substantially more at the supermarket for coffee I really know nothing about, but the flavor of this one keeps me coming back.
customer_reviews.author: Been There

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a coffee that doesn't overload my acid reflux
customer_reviews.text: I have GERD and can't drink most coffees without punishing my esophagus. This one is easy on my stomach and I often drink it black (as I can't stand the taste of creamer) If I wake up feeling acidic I'll pair it with some cashew milk and that seems to do the trick. If you have an ultra sensitive tummy, I would also recommend trying Java Planet, as it seems slightly less acidic than Don Pablo's but is also twice the cost. Both are worth trying if you're like me, a coffee addict with stomach issues that prefers black coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Rocks in Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I found two rocks in my coffee on two different brews. I emailed the company but they didn’t respond so this is how I’m responding. Please check the coffee for rocks...
customer_reviews.author: R. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Thank Goodness!! Great Organic Coffee
customer_reviews.text: The price is right for this wonderful, organic, aromatic coffee. I'm always worried when I try a new coffee.because many times I get a really bad headache. I think it has something to do with the processing. I haven't been able to get my regular organic coffee from Trader Joes, and was floored by the prices at many of the smaller roasters. I decided to give Amazon a try and the reviews for Don Pablo coffee were great, plus it had a decent price. No headache and the taste is wonderful. I got the beans and I grind them fresh every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Worst Coffee Ever
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this coffee due to all the good reviews. Tastes like I brewed up an ashtray of old cigarette butts. Undrinkable, even if you use a very small amount to compensate for the strong cigarette butt taste. I tried several times to make a drinkable cup. No way is this possible. I bought a big bag of both the decaf and the regular and both are just as bad. Now they are in the garbage. I don't know where the good reviews of these products came from. Stay away!! Also, you should know this product is not returnable. When going to the returns page you see "This item isn't eligible for return". Not surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchase

customer_reviews.title: It gave me upset stomach and I didn't like the taste
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this product after reading all the good reviews. My first cup it gave me an upset stomach. So, I thought maybe I made it too strong. The next day I made another cup it's the same thing. I know coffee can irritate your gut but i usually have no problem with one cup a day. Too be fair, maybe it's just me. Now the taste, I did not like the taste at all comparing to Starbucks coffee. If you are thinking about trying this brand, I suggest you try it first if you can. I do not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Lee

customer_reviews.title: Waking up in the morning to a bad cup of coffee is just wrong
customer_reviews.text: If you're serious about your coffee, you might have found that buying coffee online is one of the more stressful things one may encounter in online purchasing. Waking up in the morning to a bad cup of coffee is just wrong. I am happy to say - simply - that this online purchase was a complete win, and I am seriously enjoying every cup of coffee I've had from it. A note on my tastes - I stay away from coffees that are overly acidic or fruity. I prefer richer, chocolate, low acid, and smooth coffee.
customer_reviews.author: coastjunkie

customer_reviews.title: If you like Starbucks, you’ll LOVE this coffee
customer_reviews.text: I drink my coffee without sweeteners or cream so keep this in mind in my review. The coffee tastes great hot at first brew, but if it sits at all or get used for iced coffee, it has a bitter taste much like Starbucks coffees. This coffee seems to be high quality, smells good, but to my palate is not for me. If you like Starbucks coffee, you will likely love this coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Burnt smell and taste
customer_reviews.text: BURNT. I knew better than to buy this after seeing several reviews stating it had a burnt smell and taste. Sure enough, I tried to force the first and only cup down, but it was too much. How does this company knowingly sell this product? I just don't believe there are people tasting the product before sale and saying, "yep, this is good stuff". So disappointed. I don't leave many reviews, but if this helps just one unsuspecting customer, it will be worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: TASTES LIKE COFFEE THAT'S BEEN BREWED IN AN ASHTRAY!
customer_reviews.text: I hate to write a negative review about anything, but this is the worst coffee I've ever tasted. I don't smoke, but have been around smokers' houses and smelled ashtrays, and this coffee (made in 2 different, good coffeemakers) tastes as if I had added the contents of an ashtray and brewed it. "Smoky" flavor is an understatement. Gave it away and that person also said the same. She gave it back, I tried it again, and then threw it out. Good for smokers, maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Seymourstreet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent organic beans at a steal of a price
customer_reviews.text: I usually pay $12.30 per pound for organic, medium-roast Ethiopian beans from Trader Joe's. They're delicious and consistently good. But these beans, organic, medium-roast Marcala, were $16.99 for two pounds, and came with high recommendations. I thought I'd give them a try (and save about $4.00 per pound in the process). These are excellent beans, flavorful, almost sweet, not bitter. I grind them fine and filter them through a reusable cotton filter (
customer_reviews.author: BarryG

customer_reviews.title: Smooth cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: My son did a lot of research on different coffees when he wanted to start making it at home, and we ordered this one. We absolutely love it! I had given up dairy about 2 years ago and was using coconut cream in my coffee, but when COVID hit and I couldn't go to the stores, I decided to try to drink my coffee black. Mind you, I've always drank it with lots of cream and sugar. But this coffee is so smooth, it didn't take me long to drink it black. A definite try!
customer_reviews.author: FunwiththeGun

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: I can’t stand instant, but I won’t buy Starbucks. I’m a in the middle coffee drinker. Been drinking black rifle for a year (which is really good). I’ve had reflux for several years and decided it was time to find something that tastes good, is mellow on the tummy, and affordable. This brand just about fits in all categories. It’s a medium brew so as to not overpower the taste buds. The beans have a strange glossy coat. Not sure why. But they ground up nicely. I drink 2 cups everyday. Almost a month. Can’t say there’s a big difference on the belly. Taste and price are right on point. May try a mix brew.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: NOT Medium-Dark Roast
customer_reviews.text: I am very familiar with roasting darkness, as I have roasted my own coffees for quite a few years. I recently decided to try pre-roasted coffees and save the effort of roasting. My first purchase was a medium roast and was good, but I prefer a little darker, so when I saw this "Medium Dark" roast, I tried it. It is very DARK, verging in Italian roast - if you like it that dark, it's not bad, but if you want medium dark, this is NOT for you. I hope they either change their roasting level claim or lighten it up a little. Medium dark should still show some brown color - this is very black.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Moldy and tastes bad
customer_reviews.text: After brewing several cups thinking that my coffee pot was going or I couldn't get the ratio right- I realized not only did the coffee taste terrible but it was saturated in mold! Now I know that all coffee has a little bit of mold regardless- but this was visible, green mold in every cup I ground up. The mold didn't appear after storing it- it was there from the moment of grinding. I threw away the first couple cups of ground beans after discovering it, only only to realize that every cup ended the same- with green mold in the jar. What's worse is the return policy says I can't send it back. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: PittieMama

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, good price
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy quality coffee. This is quite good, and at the price it may become my go to. Keep in mind that this is Amazon. You could always find more fresh coffee elsewhere, but you'll pay waaay more. I'm not going to get into dark/light, acidity, sweetness/bitterness, complexity, etc. I'll say that I enjoy high quality coffee, and I really enjoy this coffee. My one complaint is freshness. You'll want to use this in 2 weeks because it will start to lose its flavor, but that's really to be expected. I'd recommend this coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Will W.

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 5-pound bag of this coffee and thought it was delicious. I don't understand those bad reviews unless maybe they were paid off by the competition or something hard to say maybe a bad batch I don't know but the coffee that I received smelled wonderful taste wonderful it was not bitter it had a rich flavor. I'm going to order another bag. It's always puzzling to me when you have very conflicting reviews but we must remember that everybody has different preferences, that goes for food, art, music and of course...coffee. I guess that my bottom line is that this is Affordable coffee that tastes good, everything that I love is getting so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Presley

customer_reviews.title: Fresh and delicious taste...
customer_reviews.text: I am a coffee lover. My wife travels to many countries and my only request is always to bring me coffee from every nation. I have tried many coffees and this one is one of my favorites. Every time I have my coffee in the morning I feel like I want to go back for another minutes later. No bitterness, not acid at all. Just the way I like my coffee. For my taste it is perfect...
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: This coffee is sooo good, it is now The staple coffee for our whole family!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried various coffees from Amazon and many are good...very good. But when you're looking for a coffee to get you started in the morning, and is GOOD for you (it's organic)...and it still has all of its natural oils pack in the bean...and comes in a 2 lb. easy-to-store pack.....and tastes like you're standing in the middle of the Honduran coffee fields...You Can't Beat this Coffee. I have a bit of half and half, but tastes great straight too. If you try this coffee just one time, you'll be hooked. I hand grind the whole bean. It's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: C Klostermeier

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money! Low acidity. Better than starbucks
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews in search for a good flavored espresso. Don’t let the smell of the brewed coffee fool you. It has a burnt smell, however it does not taste burnt at all. I was slightly disappointed that I did not taste the rich chocolate under notes or the Caramel and honey flavors. Keep in mind that this is a dark coffee. Has a much smoother flavor than Starbucks. This espresso is low acidity because it didn’t bother my stomach at all. I made it in a French press: 2 tablespoons of fresh ground coffee and 1 cup of almost boiling hot water, steep 4 Mins.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best coffee out there for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: This is some great coffee. After the stores around my area stopped selling the brand I liked. I was on the hunt for some good decent coffee. Tried alot of different brands/types and not finding what I'm looking for. Until now. This coffee is great. Good flavor all the way. The medium roast is perfect for what I like. Its a dark roast but does not taste burnt like some other leading brands. They roast their beans perfectly. Very very happy with this coffee and the group who makes it. Keep up the great coffees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer in westland, Mi

customer_reviews.title: Interestingly great.
customer_reviews.text: I've been in search for a good coffee that I can subscribe to and never run out. I have no local roasters within 30 miles so online is the way to go. I received this coffee today and I do believe it is one of the best med coffees I've ever ordered. I will try their light roast next and then commit to 5lbs. I'm certain that will last for a good 2 months. As far as the flavor and taste, it is balanced. Just overall a great cup that I can see having almost every day. For $17 it is worth trying.
customer_reviews.author: Jay504702

customer_reviews.title: Looks light, tastes great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee! It is delicious. I have had issues with some coffee not being kind to my stomach. This coffee doesn't upset my stomach at all. I was very skeptical when I brewed my first pot. It looked so much lighter than what I am used to when it was in the carafe. The taste, however, was excellent. It has lots of flavor without the ammonia smell that a lot of coffees have. I love it so much, I set it up for regular delivery. I have my mom hooked on this now too! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: AM A ZON ADDICT

customer_reviews.title: Good Joe...but, not my cup of tea
customer_reviews.text: After my first brew...I have decided that taste buds must be like love....beauty is in the eye of the beholder.....or different strokes for different folks. While I did find this brew to be a good cup of java...it didn't knock my socks off.....many reviews by the pros...describing hints of honey, chocolate, cherry, tobacco, whatever etc etc...go right over my head.......I found this brew to somewhat smooth and gentle and did not achieve the bold robust knock your taste buds socks off...that I had rarely experienced on a few random, unknown cups over the years....The search goes on...but like I mentioned...this could be some folks perfect match?
customer_reviews.author: pedro spearshaker

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good, But Local Rules
customer_reviews.text: This is good coffee. I have no complaints really, and I think it tastes delicious. However, it's not quite good enough to stop from me continuing to buy fresh coffee from the local bulk bins at my natural foods store. I just bought it online this once because I couldn't get the fresh coffee locally temporarily and I wanted to try Amazon. If I need to order coffee online, its likely I will choose this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mind Floss

customer_reviews.title: A good coffee bean !
customer_reviews.text: I found this coffee on a Google search reviewing coffee beans & was ranked fourth best out of ten reviewed. Then found here on Amazon at a great price & the coffee lived up to the review. I use a burr grinder & have ground it a few different coarseness & each have delivered great coffee. My favorite is ground very coarse then use old fashion percolator, the percolator reaches temperatures that extract flavor from the beans that drip makers dream about plus paper filters rob you of so much flavor !!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the cleanest coffees I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee, the only thing I am going to change is to go to the Dark Roast version because the Medium Dark Roast has a little more caffeine punch than I want. That said, it is awesome quality that you can even see when you visually inspect the beans. I am grinding coarse and using a French Press with a filter paper and I am getting coffee like it was from a 5 star restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: oomph-less espresso
customer_reviews.text: After extensive "dialing-in" the grind, amounts, tamps, times and water temperatures, I am unable to get a decent tasting shot from this coffee. I am disappointed as I was really looking forward to results like those expressed in the higher reviews. But, to me, this coffee has no real distinguishing tastes/flavor hints, neither acid, bright, sour or bitter, just meh. Will probably go back to the lighter roasts as I seem to have better luck with them. BTW, the wife says it should be 3 stars, so maybe her taste and smell buds are not as jaded as mine.
customer_reviews.author: Rag_dude

customer_reviews.title: This is the brand to buy!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best purchase I have made in a long time. The regular store brands (Folgers, Maxwell House) would iritate my stomach and it was always bitter. This brand is soo smooth and full of flavor it's hard to stop drinking. It is a low acid organic bean and it doesn't mess with your stomach. I recommended this to my dad who has stomach issues and had give up coffee for the most part and now he is back to the ole routine. Buy more than you think because you will be having that afternoon cup more often!
customer_reviews.author: DLW1967

customer_reviews.title: No stomach pain or IBS
customer_reviews.text: I'm relieved to have coffee again. I have IBS that is complicated with bouts of gastritis. Coffee is the instigator for the gastritis every time but I need it's energy. I've had NO Problem!! Thank goodness I can drink it again. When I try my old favorite the gastritis immediately causes my pain to begin all day. Not this! I usually life a light roast but this medium had best reviews. Light roasts in general have more acid. I simply adjust the strength with less of this coffee to the cup of water. Prefect.
customer_reviews.author: Jilllane

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent taste from bag to bag
customer_reviews.text: This coffee is unfortunately very inconsistent with taste i just got my second bag and it tastes nothing like the first bag. It has a burnt flavor and really almost no flavor. I contacted the seller who gave me a refund. I guess my search for some good organic coffee will have to continue....
customer_reviews.author: dena

customer_reviews.title: I SO wanted to love this coffee but....
customer_reviews.text: This coffee is very weak and a total disappointment. I went by the reviews and got duped. Now I can’t even get my money back or exchange for another of their products. How does a person reach this company? EDIT: I needed to come back and say that this company made good on their promise and refunded my money when I told them that I didn’t care for the coffee. That says a LOT about their integrity so I give them 5 stars for being so responsible. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: ShopsAlot

customer_reviews.title: So organic that you may get stones
customer_reviews.text: Good organic coffee for the price. I've had all 3 blends and think medium is just right for a French Press. Low acid means it won't give you heartburn. The only problem I've ever had was the last bag of light roast contained 2 small grey stones that nearly ruined my grinder. Fortunately, both times I saw the sparks flying and saved my blade not to mention saving myself from whatever possibly toxic stuff could have been in those rocks. Looks like this coffee is totally out of stock now. Maybe others reported similar issues?
customer_reviews.author: Metal Manic

customer_reviews.title: My all-time favorite coffee - the smoothest cup you'll ever have!
customer_reviews.text: This is my all-time favorite coffee. It's the smoothest cup of coffee you'll ever have! Seriously. I've tried a decent amount of coffees, usually organic. 100% Kona as well (definitely tasty). I usually prefer a medium or light roast. This is by far the tastiest, smoothest coffee I've ever had! It makes me look forward to my morning. The bag is a BIG bag of beans, so it's very reasonably​ priced for a giant bag of organic coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love dark and smooth coffee. Starbucks Sumatra and Kenya was what I used to buy and I've tried other brands as well. I don't remember how I found this coffee but I just love it. It makes my oat milk cappuccino just the way I like. I now hardly go to Starbucks or other coffee shop. The price and the quality is great. I have it on auto delivery. I'm happy I'm saving a lot of money by not spending over priced coffee at Starbucks.
customer_reviews.author: Blue bear

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor, very smooth
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the coffee. it was smooth and easy to drink. I consume a lot of coffee and I really enjoyed this roast. Next purchase will be the dark roast. I'm hoping for a more complex taste, but I'm satisfied with the taste of this one. Great value for the quality of the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: MVM

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TASTING COFFEE
customer_reviews.text: This was my first purchase of this brand of coffee, I must say it’s very good. I had to dial down the strength on my Breville Coffee Maker slightly. My first pot was way too strong with the settings I’d been using. Once I got the strength set to my liking I really enjoy the taste of this coffee. I will definitely be buying another bag when I run out. It’s a little more pricey than other coffee beans I’ve bought in the past, but must say it tastes better than everything I’ve bought so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it- but not always available. .
customer_reviews.text: we have a monthly subscription because we love it What I don’t like is the fact that We have to wait sometimes to get it. I’m always afraid we will run out and forced to buy someone else’s coffee.
customer_reviews.author: L. G. Royer

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee for brewing
customer_reviews.text: I have been ordering this coffee for more than a year. I have been a heavy coffee drinker my whole life. Tried so many different brands, but this so far proved to be one of the best to my taste for brewed coffee. And you cannot beat the price, especially considering that it is organic. We are more of espresso drinkers, meaning we like our coffee strong, dark and with a hint of bitterness, and no acidity or it goes down the drain. This coffee delivers all of this without the burned smell and taste of Starbucks, or the acidity that you can find in so many brands on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Not medium roast
customer_reviews.text: Do not like the roast type or flavor. Price is good for organic coffee. Maybe that is why. This is definitely a dark roast coffee, smells and looks dark. Then after grinding it is dark and tastes like the french roast type. I ended up only making a couple pots then went out and purchased something else. I only like medium or mild roast. Was really hoping to find this with such a good price for organic. Will not purchase again, it is too dark and bitter for me.
customer_reviews.author: L. G. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Best low acidic coffee
customer_reviews.text: This makes a great cup of medium full bodied coffee. I drink two cups hot in the morning and also a cold brew version of it in the afternoon. I have no problems with my GERD. I’ve tried other low acidic coffees but this is the best in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect flavor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this organic coffee because I needed a coffee without the harsh chemicals and bitterness of regular supermarket coffees. I absolutely love this coffee because its not bitter and it tastes amazing. I will be buying this from now on and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Igeorges1220

customer_reviews.title: first brew is a winner
customer_reviews.text: I am just enjoying the first brew. Using a cone drip machine. I'm able to use less grounds for a tasty pot. This a competitive price and the taste is very good. I am trying a new storage method so buying in bulk will keep the beans fresh. Using 1/2 gal glass jar with a valve lid that has a pump to vacate the oxygen. I was concerned seeing that the medium roast beans seemed rather oily that some clogging would occur. Not to worry no clogging.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Reaaaaallly gooooood
customer_reviews.text: Tore into this the second it arrived, which was fast! Ordered sunday night and it was on my doorstep tuesday. It looks, smells, feels, and tastes like real bread. I love the sesame seeds coating the outside. Reminds me of any other bakery bread. It's soft enough out of the package that it doesn't need to be toasted to be edible. I'm in the middle of a peanut butter and bacon sandwich as I type this. Looking forward to my daily grilled cheese. Super stoked.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: bleh
customer_reviews.text: Well smelled fresh, looked amazing, burned and not flavorful at all. someone mentioned it correctly, reviews are weird. they're uniformly burned beyond flavor, that time when you reached top flavor then forgot to turn off the roasting oven. smooth and not acidic ?technically if you burn beans it becomes more smooth and less acidic, but if you love your coffee stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Boryozka

customer_reviews.title: Even my son hated this coffee
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and only buy organic coffee beans and mainly from my local grocer. Not so fresh from the plastic bins there,,,so I tried this. It tastes and smells more like a soap than coffee. Paradoxically, I ordered coffee from a Canadian Company - less expensive and free shipping. What a difference. Their coffee beans are roasted the day they ship. The aroma was heavenly. I was told by Amazon I would be refunded. Ha, that has not happened.
customer_reviews.author: SandraintheSand

customer_reviews.title: Just not my cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: First ordered one bag and was sent and charged with two. Do not like the coffee. I want my black coffee to have a coffee aftertaste and this has a very noticeable chocolaty aftertaste. And so low acid I don't get the coffee kick from a cup. Just me, a lot of people reviewing love it. It is also not returnable! Stuck with almost 5# of this stuff. Buyer be very aware, seems to be a niche thing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Heilman

customer_reviews.title: After taste
customer_reviews.text: Good price but I guess I am more of a coffee snob than I thought. This coffee tastes kinda burnt. Leaves a bad residual taste. Not a clean taste with pleasant after taste as advertised! Not a good taste...Food goods are not returnable so guess I wasted $$....Should be some sort or guarantee....Small beans, dry (light weight and not like other brands I have received) so maybe they are old ....Not worth $$
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, this is it!
customer_reviews.text: OMG I have bought so many coffees...finally, a dark roast that's smooth, not bitter, it arrived so fresh the whole box smelled like I could drink it, and the price is insanely fair. YES! After this first order, I immediately subscribed to monthly shipment.
customer_reviews.author: maldoliza

customer_reviews.title: Super yummy!
customer_reviews.text: Tastes wonderful. I grind it fresh every morning to use either in my French press, drip maker, or my Vietnamese coffee maker. Tastes delish however I brew it. Beans are a beautiful shiny black, and the aroma that hits me every morning when I open the bag is just heavenly.
customer_reviews.author: adventurebabbler

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Low Acid Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is a delicious coffee. I grind on course. I use a ninja drip coffee maker. My coffee does not taste bitter or have a bad aftertaste at all. This is by far, one of the best low acid coffees I have tried. I do not know the exact lever of caffeine in these beans, but I can tell you that they are stronger then many other low acid coffees, as others have tended to literally make me tired. Crazy!! This coffee is definitely worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Storey

customer_reviews.title: Rich and Delicious Organic Coffee Beans
customer_reviews.text: This coffee is delicious! I’ve been trying to find organic coffee beans that are fresh and roasted to perfection. I found them right here on Amazon! Cafe Don Pablo is it! I love that I can buy it in 2 or 5 pound sizes, and put it on Subscribe & Save. Thank you, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Paulette G. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Wont Be Purchasing This Again
customer_reviews.text: I purchsed this coffee due to all of the good reviews. When I opened the bag the beans looked and smelled good. After several tries I wont be purchasing it again. I use a french press and followed the instructions. The first pot was weak and watery tasting. I used more coffee grounds per cup for the next pot ending up with a bitter, harsh cup of coffee. I should have stuck with the Mayorga which is what I normally buy. I never have issues with their coffees. Also cant return the item so I am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: A 2 star is because of me.
customer_reviews.text: The coffee was delivered on time. Smelled AWESOME!Then I noticed it wasn't decaf. Big boo-hoo! I went back to my orders to see if it was their fault or mine. Turns out got what I ordered. As I looked I saw 2 products over was the decaf. I can't rate it higher cause I was unable to taste it. I wanted to grind those beans and use it in my french press. I guess I'll shell to buy the decaf. :_(
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting cup of coffee without the Acid Reflux!
customer_reviews.text: The beans smell wonderful. The description is true to taste. The beans are of GREAT quality: you can see the oils on the beans! The beans are roasted perfectly, so there isn't a burnt taste like some other coffees. This coffee makes a great french pressed cup of coffee too! I have GERD, and I love coffee; however, I have issues with acidity. This coffee doesn't aggravate my GERD, so I highly recommend this brand of coffee for those who have acidity issues. If you like medium roasts, this is definitely a brand to try!
customer_reviews.author: J.Gross

customer_reviews.title: Low acid, yes... but
customer_reviews.text: This definitely is a solid low-acid option for anyone at risk with coffee. Would note, though, that my experience tells me you need to dump about 2x the suggested ground coffee into your machine if you want a good, strong taste. Just a little weak for me. Think I may go back to the darker roast.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Insight

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try! It’s yummy coffee ☕️
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought Don Pablo Colombian Supremo coffee beans. It was very good. So I thought I’d try this organic, since it is also a medium-dark roast. They are similar in taste. So I was happy. I think I’ll continue to buy this organic coffee, since I like the idea of buying organic when I can. It is very good organic coffee, at a good price.. I recommend to people, to give it a try. Thanks Don Pablo!😊
customer_reviews.author: Barbara B

customer_reviews.title: Smooth cup of morning joy
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed the full bodied yet smooth flavor of this coffee. We appreciate the smooth finish; no bitterness or fruity finishing flavors to linger in your mouth. We enjoy bold coffee, not brown water. We would rate the coffee between a light and medium roast in the flavor which makes for a delightful morning brew.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Ward

customer_reviews.title: Organic coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've been making my coffee with Starbucks for years. Guatemalan, Ethopian, special holiday blends. I love it. But decided I wanted to go organic when I read how many chemicals are used on coffee crops. I don't really know how accurate that is, but this is organic and about half the price of Starbucks - plus I can have it auto-delivered, thereby avoiding the dreaded "Ugh! I forgot to go to Starbucks for beans yesterday!" mornings. This is a good coffee, but this medium-dark roast seems a bit too light. I guess my Starbucks is more of a dark roast and I'll try that next time. This coffee is very smooth, just needs a bit more flavor for my palate.
customer_reviews.author: Name withheld because stalkers Google me and I find it annoying

customer_reviews.title: Reliably fresh and clean flavor
customer_reviews.text: I have been drinking this coffee for years and will continue to do so as long as it tastes as it does now. I mix a 2 pound bag of this regular coffee with a 2 pound bag of the decaf ( seriously can't tell the difference) and though that's 4 pounds, it stays flavorful until I need to order more. 1 person drinking 2 liters of French press a day ( 1 cup of beans ).
customer_reviews.author: Whitters

customer_reviews.title: The price has nearly doubled!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this coffee very much and wanted to reorder it but the price has almost doubled since my last order. I tried the light roast but didn't care for the flavor of the light roast. I really like this coffee, but not for the new price. That's whyI won't buy it again and that's why I gave 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Oenone

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and Low Acid!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Don Pablo Subtle Earth Coffee because my doctors (more than one!) recommended that I switch to a coffee with low acidity due to concerns with reflux and irritation in my esophagus. I read the reviews, checked the prices, and researched low acid coffees to find the best for me. I have become a big fan of organic coffee and products that support small growers through fundraisers I have sponsored at schools. So...no brainer! I purchased Don Pablo, ground my beans for the first time in years with my 35-year-old Krups grinder, and was pleasantly surprised: delicious! I have a new morning coffee!
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Marking testy espresso
customer_reviews.text: This coffee bean making very testy espresso, Nice aroma and smooth taste. This is way batter than my experience of most of those off-the-shelf organic coffee beans from local grocery stores and/or coffee shops. I am not the profession level of the coffee maker/drinker. This review is based on my Basic daily coffee drinker.
customer_reviews.author: T-Yu C.

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to jump on the organic "coffee wagon" for a while now, but didn't find a lot of them with good flavor. I like a strong brew, but not too bitter, nothing weak. I think it has a slight hint of cocoa which I love. This coffee is absolutely delicious, I've been getting it for a while now and it's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Julita

customer_reviews.title: Lack of freshness and ashy taste
customer_reviews.text: Opening a new bag of coffee beans is always a pleasant experience. The color looked great for a medium-dark roast. However, the flavor profile is overpowered by a burnt ash taste that my taste buds just don’t appreciate. I am also concerned about the freshness. I used a Kalita Wave 185 to test and there was absolutely no gassing when doing the initial pour. It was more like looking at the top of a chocolate muffin. I suppose that is to be expected when ordering from Amazon inventory.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba Steve

customer_reviews.title: Wicked Good!!
customer_reviews.text: Smooooooth and delicious! Cafe Don Pablo Subtle Earth Organic Gourmet coffee in the medium-dark roast brews up smoothly every day in our French press. Cafe Don Pablo has a subtle clean flavor that will give you joy whenever you brew a cup. We are not fans of harsh tasting, strong coffees filled with creams, sugars, and whatever, preferring instead to let the coffee shine and be the star. Low acidity (thank you!), certified organic, and GMO free, roasted to order, plus a terrific price with subscribe and save making it a breeze to buy. Go on and treat yourself today!!
customer_reviews.author: CardiCorgiCuties

customer_reviews.title: It's really,really bad coffee
customer_reviews.text: It's horrible, hardly worth calling it coffee , bitter after taste, smells bad in the bag. It says it's unreturnable as well. I normally would be gentler in any reviews I leave but I truly hate this. My son stopped by after I brewed some and he couldn't drink it either. Don't be fooled by the description as I was!
customer_reviews.author: Connie Marie

customer_reviews.title: looks & smells great but need sug 4 a grinder plz
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure of flavor because I accidentally ordered whole bean & don't have a grinder yet. I really want a conicle burr grinder I can use for fresh press, Kerig reusable cups & espresso. I plan on getting an espresso machine soon. Any suggestions on a good grinder for all? This coffee looks & smells great. Will b great with a good grinder I think
customer_reviews.author: Julie W.

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like a cheap breakfast blend
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is organic and they have done a great job making you feel good about buying the beans. Unfortunately this tastes like Kirkland Select breakfast blend from a Keurig. It says on the bag "Full body with a deep, rich chocolaty flavor..." This is thin and slightly bitter and kind of stale. Now I'm stuck returning a 2 pound bag of beans because there is no way I'm going to drink another cup.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Hardaway

customer_reviews.title: Horrible-Not Drinkable
customer_reviews.text: This coffee was undrinkable. Clearly something is wrong with it during the roasting process. I have had other Don Pablo coffee that was great but this was beyond bad. I though my coffee pot was failing because it tasted like burnt plastic and went out and bought another coffee pot. After trying the same coffee in another expensive coffee pot I realized the coffee was a bad batch even though it smelled great.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!  My wife, though...
customer_reviews.text: I was diagnosed with some serious acid reflux and was told to try some low-acid coffee. I had no idea this even existed. Leave it up to Amazon and Google to solve the problems of the world. This coffee works great with my little problem. I haven't had any acid problems. My wife however, seems to think it tastes much different from her little Starbucks drugs.. I can't tell the difference. You might be able to, but it's worth a shot if you're hurting.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF SERVENTE

customer_reviews.title: Rich Flavor
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been ordering this coffee for a few years. It has never disappointed. A while ago they changed to a vacuum sealed packaging and that’s the only improvement we can think of that was needed. Now we don’t have to put it in a ziplock bag so that’s convenient. The quality is consistent and we will be customers for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: mari

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE COFFEE!
customer_reviews.text: WE LOVE THIS COFFEE! I've been buying this coffee for about 8 months now, and I'm finally getting around to writing a review because it's SO GOOD I have to share! We have tried other coffees, lots of others, but we like this one the best. The Organic Medium-Dark Roast whole bean is not too dark, not too mild -- the beans are just oily & perfect! We drink our coffee black, and its flavor, aroma, and taste is delicious! Not bitter, just tasty black gold.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: This is really good coffee!
customer_reviews.text: tl;dr - This coffee is really good, try it! Long version - the chocolate notes really shine and this is a really bold, low acidity brew. I generally use 2 things to determine coffee freshness. The amount of gas in the bag (freshly roasted coffee gives off CO2) and the amount of static in the coffee after grinding. While this bag was really compressed, there was no static in the grounds. Honestly, I will buy this again and again. I really cannot believe how good this coffee is! Plus, water process decaf and certified organic. Win-win in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Vallet

customer_reviews.title: Matter of Opinion
customer_reviews.text: Everything is a matter of personal opinion. With that said, I have tasted many coffee beans, some were bitter, and some was to smoky. I enjoy this coffee beans - it is smooth, not very strong, but just right. Has a wonderful flavor to it and I really enjoy drinking a cup of this coffee every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Montie Ramsarran

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this coffee! I was looking for a good medium to bold coffee that was low acid and I saw this on Amazon. I sent for a bag -- whole bean -- and we are grinding it fresh for each pot -- it is DELICIOUS!!!! I have made it in a variety of ways -- auto-drip; French Press; perked on the stove. We also like the fact that it is organic -- I have reordered it several times and think I will sign up for the auto delivery. Thanks for a wonderful cup of coffee in the morning (and afternoon :-) ) Kate C
customer_reviews.author: Kate C

customer_reviews.title: Flavorful and robust without any bitterness
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth and flavorful not bitter. I personally prefer a light, mellow coffee but my friend is coming to visit and she prefers dark roast so decided to give this a try. Discovered that I actually enjoy it too. Also got to use with my personal K-cup as the prefilled pods were getting expensive. So good I added it to subscribe and save! Always fresh and delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne L Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Coffee is weak tasting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee because i have acid reflux and this is a low acid coffee. Since i made other changes i can't ell yet whether I have less reflux due to the coffee. I make my coffee in a French press and this coffee tastes a lot weaker than the usual coffees I use. I don't know if that's a feature of all low acid coffees, or just this one. On the basis of taste alone I would not drink this coffee, but if it allows me to drink coffee without causing heartburn I will.
customer_reviews.author: david v

customer_reviews.title: Weak and no flavor
customer_reviews.text: This coffee has zero flavor. There's no robustness, nutty, chocolaty, or even an after taste. It tasted like a really weak tea even though it came out super dark and smelled great. Very, very, very disappointed. It was on the top 10 list for coffee too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite coffee hands down much better than the ones from back home in Brazil. it's smooth, not bitter and it smells amazing!!!!! You can see how fresh the beans are as soon as you open the bag! I will be buying this again :) Oh and this one is better than the Dark Roast which I found it to be too bitter and smelled burned. I hope you enjoy it too!
customer_reviews.author: T. THOM

customer_reviews.title: Nice Flavor Fresh and Rich
customer_reviews.text: I have been a coffee aficionado forever. I can honestly say this is a good bean. Smooth flavor, not wimpy depending on your scoop size, robust or flavorful mild. I will consistently order this coffee. Much organic coffee does not have this ability. Very nice. Customer for life. Good price
customer_reviews.author: IT'S ME SB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price abf flavor, aromatic, too!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent organic coffee. The price is extremely reasonable, especially as an organic brand. The aroma is heavenly and the taste was delicious! Nothing like a great cup of coffee first thing in the morning. I love to brew my own coffee from grinding the beans fresh daily to typing it off by frothing my own crème. I have a French press and the over the stove espresso maker...it's am amazing experience and worth the effort...beats Starbucks any day! I enjoy Don Pablo beans over Starbucks...theirs is too pricy and even the flavor falls short.
customer_reviews.author: TxnHeart

customer_reviews.title: This coffee is awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for organic coffee. I wanted something without the yucky pesticides. So I must say I did not really think it would be that good tasting. I bought the medium-dark blend. I am almost done with the bag! This is the best coffee I have had in a long time! Perhaps ever! I took it to work for my group of coworkers in our "coffee club" to try and they were excited about it as well! It is so smooth and perfect! I do need to make it a little stronger than other coffees. I am excited to try the other varieties and will def. Buy more of this coffee!! It is awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: MVH

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and flavorful
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this coffee. It tastes good and is not bitter at all. Very smooth, what a pleasant experience to start my day! It was originally purchased with my fingers crossed and unable to get my usual during Covid 19 quarantining. This came to me and I will be reordering. Could be my new favorite
customer_reviews.author: jenn S

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 57 and started drinking coffee about 6 months ago -- very late to the wonderful world of coffee. I discovered within the first month that I prefer a medium dark roast. I use a pour-over method, which I much prefer to the K-cup system in our house. There's absolutely no comparison. I have now tried 10 or so brands and Subtle Earth is by far my favorite. Rich, smooth, flavorful, and always very fresh. I've found my coffee!
customer_reviews.author: C. Barron

customer_reviews.title: This is a great flavorful coffee...
customer_reviews.text: This coffee is absolutely delicious. It is super fresh, and the flavor notes are represented well in the description... chocolaty undertones and very smooth. This replaces all other coffees that I typically buy and will continue to only buy this brand, provided that there isn't an increase in price. Naturally weather and market conditions affect this factor. Currently, the price is just right for this particular coffee (also factoring in free Prime shipping) and I definitely appreciate companies that bring quality products and do not price gouge and instead make them available to a greater segment of the masses. Great roasters, great company history, and a bonus in that the owner/operator is heavily involved and even responds to reviews.
customer_reviews.author: chicago esquire

customer_reviews.title: No flavor, no coffee smell
customer_reviews.text: This coffee has NO coffee flavor. My first cup was like drinking warm, brown water. Maybe the grind is wrong but it is what we use for our reusable k cups. It does not have that fresh coffee smell. I will not order again. I was pleased to find a PC coffee in my price range but I will have to keep looking. For now it will just be a base for flavored creamers.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee but...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order. The coffee is awsome but the last bag had a slight tear. I'm not picky but who knows how long the bag was sitting there, open... Cant return but Amazon kindly gave me a refund. I'm sure it was a freak thing but I'm not that desperate. Unfortunately, its going in the trash. If it happens again, it goes from 5 to 2 stars. The quality of coffee all depends on the seal & quality of packaging!
customer_reviews.author: eL

customer_reviews.title: Taste!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my second order so I have had an opportunity to give this coffee the rating it deserves. It was delivered in a timely manner! It's not overly acidic. It's flavor compares to the best coffee I've experienced in other countries....Italy, Peru, Egypt, Africa. I highly recommend this wonderful coffee. The taste and aroma are enticing and it delivers more than I would have hoped for. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Browning

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Been drinking this coffee for over a year. Still enjoy it. No problems with packaging and and love opening the bag and smelling the coffee. Neighbors when they taste the coffee often ask for it again when they visit.
customer_reviews.author: Buckwheat

customer_reviews.title: OUR NEW FAVORITE
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, clean flavor with not a hint of bitterness. Pure coffee as is should be. From basic black coffee to cappuccino this coffee is the BEST.
customer_reviews.author: pasdedeux

customer_reviews.title: Rich, robust and drinkable (not overwhelming)
customer_reviews.text: I almost don’t want to write a review this is so good! I’ve roasted my own and had some of the best coffees in the world. I love this one. The flavor of our first bag we compared with pure 100% Kona, African and South American blends. This mix and roast is a great combination that is both sophisticated and drinkable—the depth of Kona without the overwhelming flavors and the richness of other South American flavors without the acid. We are now dedicated customers.
customer_reviews.author: Selly

product_meta.title: 2LB Subtle Earth Organic Coffee - Medium-Dark Roast - Whole Bean - Organic Arabica Coffee - (2 lb) Bag
feature_bullets: Certified Organic by CCOF - 100% Arabica Coffee - GMO Free
Rich and chocolaty with profound depth of flavor, velvety body, and low acidity
Try Don Pablo Risk-Free: Buy now, and if you don't love our coffees, contact us directly through Amazon, and we will happily refund your order
